ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.timeout.worker

Class Timeout

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.timeout.worker.Timeout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Timeout>

    public class Timeout
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Timeout>
    A timeout implementation to be used with a TimeoutWorker. Timeouts are associated with a SocketIF and a TimeoutListener. When a timeout is expired, it notifies the listener of the expiration, at which time the listener should act on the timeout (e.g. closing the socket, performing an SSL/TLS re-handshake and so on).
    Since:
    0.18
    See Also:
    TimeoutWorker, TimeoutWorker

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timeout

        public Timeout(SocketIF socket,
       TimeoutListener listener,
       long timeout)
        Create a new timeout for the SocketIF given. If the timeout expires, it will fire TimeoutListener.timeoutExpired(SocketIF) on the associated listener.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket the timeout is to be associated with
        listener - The listener listening for timeout expiration on this socket
        timeout - The timeout period

        public void expired()
        Sets this timeout to expired state, firing any attached listeners in the process.

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        Check whether or not this timeout is expired right now. If the timeout was set to its expired state via expired(), time checking is not performed, returning true directly.
        Returns:
        whether or not this timeout is expired right now

      • hasExpired

        public boolean hasExpired()
        Whether or not this timeout already had its associated expired() method called and had its TimeoutListener fired.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this timeout already had its associated expired() method called and had its TimeoutListener fired.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Timeout t)
        Overrides the Comparable interface to allow timeouts to be compared. Timeouts are compared based on their absolute expiration times.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Timeout>
        Parameters:
        t - The timeout to compare to
        Returns:
        A negative value if the current timeout's expiration time is earlier than the one of the given timeout, a positive value if it is later, or 0 if both timeouts expire at the same time
